text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified them nor does it vouch for their accuracy.
- Macedonian justice minister Vlado Popovski rejected all allegations that the government will "create conditions for new electoral fraud" and accused the opposition of manipulating public opinion.
- Private doctors' association blames the government for bureaucratic problems and manipulations with the social security fund.

- Macedonian canning and vegetable processing firms demand delay of their obligations towards the PHARE programme until December 25 in order to meet their obligations towards the primary vegetable producers.

- Macedonian production rose by three percent in the first nine months of this year compared to the same period last year. Exports in the first eight months of this year stood at $583 million, 29.1 percent less than the same period in 1995. Imports stood at $1.027 billion, down by 4.5 percent on the same period last year. The trade deficit is $443 million.
- There are 1,429,288 Macedonians registered to vote.
- A public tender has been issued for 542 construction plots in Macedonia.
- Macedonian government has approved emergency imports of 150,000 tonnes of gas to counter the crisis caused by the interruption of the operation of the OCTA refinery.
